page.title: 15SAVING SWANS IN WINDSOR
page.content:
{Zylla Cooke}is a vet's wife who looks after swans and other animals. In the Windsor area she helps injured swans to get back to health and back on the river. The problems concerning swans are lead poisoning due to fishing weights getting stuck in their throat, also nylon line gets stuck too. The way it affects the swans is they develop a kink in their necks. Sometimes they are not able to fly or walk.
{Mrs. Cooke}uses drugs to cure them and it takes about 6 - 8 months to cure their illness.
The public reaction is now quite good but sometimes people do not realise that these beautiful birds could become extinct. We can help by not throwing litter in the water.
